newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Glorious Sun's JeansWest 96/97 sales rise.
newsitem.headline: Glorious Sun's JeansWest 96/97 sales rise.

text.p: Casual clothing retailer JeansWest Australia said on Tuesday its sales for the year to March 31, 1997 rose 22 percent to A$98.3 million despite tough retail conditions in the Australian clothing market.
JeansWest, a subsidiary of Hong Kong's Glorious Sun Enterprises, said the result was an important contributor to its parents 29 percent sales rise announced last week.

"While there may be some improvement in retail conditions overall in Australia and New Zealand in the coming year, this will not necessarily flow through to clothing retailers as a whole," JeansWest's managing director David Lawn said.
Lawn said the retailers store numbers in Australia and New Zealand had risen by 30 to 161 during the year and the company planned to open another 30 stores by March, 1998.
